Subject: Weekly State of the Market - Precious Metals (2025-09-16)

Precious Metals

Executive Summary

The latest Commitments of Traders (COT) data for Precious Metals presents a nuanced picture. Gold speculators are heavily net-long, showing significant bullish conviction, but this tapered off slightly this week. Palladium exhibits extreme speculative bearishness, yet short covering is evident. Silver remains bullish, while Platinum shows increasing bullish momentum. Micro Gold's bullish conviction slightly softened.

Key Opportunities

  • Palladium Short Squeeze: Speculators hold an extreme net-short position (Z-score: -2.23), but a week-over-week reduction in net shorts signals active short covering, ripe for a rapid price surge on positive news.
  • Platinum Building Momentum: Increased speculative net-longs this week indicate growing conviction, suggesting potential for continued upward price action.

Key Risks

  • Gold Exhaustion: Gold speculators are extremely net-long (Z-score: 2.08), and a modest reduction in net-longs week-over-week suggests potential for profit-taking and a sharp correction if bullish momentum falters.
  • Silver Waning Conviction: Despite overall bullish positioning, a slight decrease in speculative net-longs week-over-week implies diminishing conviction, which could lead to price weakness.

Asset Class Summaries

Gold

  • Speculators:Dominantly bullish with a substantial net-long position (158,971 contracts). This position decreased by 4,548 contracts WoW, but remains at elevated levels (Z-score: 2.08).
  • Commercials:Maintain a significant net-short stance (-65,384 contracts), typically acting as counter-trend hedgers.
  • Implication:High speculative bullishness exists, but the WoW reduction in net-longs raises an exhaustion risk.

Silver

  • Speculators:Strongly bullish with a net-long position (35,806 contracts). This saw a minor decrease of 49 contracts WoW (Z-score: 1.59).
  • Commercials:Heavily net-short (-27,925 contracts), consistent with hedging activity.
  • Implication:Solid bullish sentiment among speculators, but the slight reduction in longs warrants monitoring for waning conviction.

Platinum

  • Speculators:Net-long (13,086 contracts) and increasing by 1,272 contracts WoW. Positioning is moderately bullish (Z-score: 0.88).
  • Commercials:Net-short (-19,402 contracts), maintaining their hedging activity.
  • Implication:Growing speculative interest suggests potential for continued upward price momentum.

Palladium

  • Speculators:Extremely net-short (-5,191 contracts). However, net shorts decreased by 775 contracts WoW, indicating short covering (Z-score: -2.23).
  • Commercials:Also net-short (-2,077 contracts).
  • Implication:Extreme bearish positioning combined with recent short covering creates conditions for a potential short squeeze.

Micro Gold

  • Speculators:Net-long (1,860 contracts), but this decreased by 186 contracts WoW. Positioning is neutral to slightly bullish (Z-score: 0.03).
  • Commercials:Net neutral (0 contracts).
  • Implication:Speculative conviction is present but has slightly softened, indicating a more cautious stance.
